All of those stats, stated above, were from an almost completely different defensive coaching staff. This upcoming year, the Bills and Rex Ryan have brought in and filled all of the coaching positions (the exception being Donnie Henderson and some of the assistant staff) with former Jets coaches. Now, with that in mind, how do they exactly plan on being better than the system of the previous year when you are utilizing coaches that, though performed well, did not exceed last year's rankings?

Jets rankings under our new coaches (Dennis Thurman-DC, Bobby April III-LB, Karl Dunbar-DL and Tim McDonald-DB), for 2014:

Total yds: 6th - 5235
Yds/gm: 6th - 327.2
Pass yds total: 14th - 3746
/gm: 14th - 234.1

Rush yds total (the only aspect that beat the Bills for 2014): 5th - 1489
/gm: 5th - 93.1
This we'll compare to the Bills stats, as these are less advertised...
Total rush yds: 11th - 1703
/gm: 11th 106.4

Lastly, where it matters, points allowed.
Jets total: 24th - 401
/gm: 24th - 25.1
Bills total: 4th - 289
/gm: 18.1

Obviously none of the matters if the offense cannot do its job. My point though, is quit shoveling this nonsense of wanting to be better. That's an absolute given, or at least it should be with how much these players are paid. As far as I am concerned, I feel that they should have left well enough alone with Jim Schwartz as the DC and his line/LB staff. They did outstanding last year. I fully support a shake up with DB coaching as it was the big plays that burned the team last year, but the D-line was an absolute beast as were our linebackers. 

I am excited for the season regardless, but I feel that the coaching staff was edited in the wrong places and true issues weren't completely addressed, such as the O-line. Now if we were to go and make an offer to Evan Mathis, that would be extraordinary, but it's the Bills, they won't and we will see another mediocre season come and go with people wondering why our defense was worse than it was last year....

data.message: A true legend that will be missed !  The beloved voice of the Bills,,,, a runner up to no one !  He was simply the best in the business hands down. Many prayers for Van Miller's family..

Jamie Laux-I know exactly what you mean, what you're saying, and how you feel: been there/done that. BUT, if we can legitimately win eight games {I do not count our week 17 "win" over the Brady-less for the 2nd half, and Gronk-less Deflatriots game as a legitimate win} with two High School coaches {}HC and OC}, a QB we pulled off the couch straight out of retirement that CLEARLY was ONLY on the fiel;d for the paycheck, a severely regressed O-Line, and pretty much NO running game, then I think we seriously do have a legitimate chance to win two more games this year, which would have us ending the season at 10-6, quite possibly enough wins to break this horrid playoff drought. Think about it ; we'll have twice as much production {maybe even more pending on the O-Line} from the run game, whichever QB does step up to the plate will do as good, but probably better than Kyle "slide for no gain when I need two yards for the crucial first down" Orton, a TE that can produce more/better than Scott Chandler on Chandler's best day and his worst, a better O-Line with a true, documented "bully", and former Pro Bowler whom Rex and Whaley {and the Pegulas} gave his FINAL chance to play the game he loves whom has a huge chip on his shoulder with something to prove, along with a promising rookie at the opposite G position, Glenn is in a contract year as well and will play like it too, a dynamic ST/KO/Punt return man whom also might be getting his last shot at redemption and playing the game he loves as well and a bonafide THREAT to go the distance every time he touches the ball, all while also retaining the entire fourth ranked overall defense {minus the part time S Searcy}. All that being the case, the biggest upgrade and what will push us over the top more than anything else is the exit of Hack and Moron and the entrance of two very legitimate, respected coaches.

I had the honor of escorting my 90 year old dad on this trip to DC to visit the WWll Memorial, and both Fred and Manny were along to help - not to promote themselves... We were at the airport by 4:00 AM and returned that night about 10:00 PM. Throughout the day, they assisted the veterans in any way they could and made certain the day was about the Vets - not themselves. They were also there to honor Ralph Wilson - a former veteran who donated $25,000. To the Buffalo Honor Flight. This trip is absolutely free to the veterans and they are treated like the heroes they are. If you know of a WWll Vet, there will be another trip in October. You can find the information online. It truly is a trip of a lifetime and one that my dad and I will remember always. Thank you, to the Wylie sisters and Buffalo Honor Flight for making this possible. And, thank you to Ralph Wilson for his donation and to all the volunteers - including Fred and Manny - who made this possible.
